Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate two different habitats, one on land and one in water, to show diversity in the types of living things.
The student can observe and draw various plants and animals found in each habitat using firsthand observations or media resources.
The student can label the different types of living things, such as trees, grasses, animals, fishes, or plants, included in each habitat.
The student can compare and contrast the types of living things present in the land habitat versus the water habitat.
The student can demonstrate an understanding of patterns by showing how some living things are specific to certain habitats.
The student can organize and clearly present the data in their drawing to reflect patterns of biodiversity in the two habitats.
